byline.contributor: Al Baker, Stephanie Clifford and Stuart Miller contributed r eporting.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and NATE SCHWEBER

abstract: Arrest of Akhror Saidakhmetov, Abdurasul Hasanovich Juraboev and Abror Habibov represents first case in New York City of people plotting to travel overseas to join Islamic State; authorities say three men fit no particular profile, illustrating challenges facing law enforcement in determining credible threats.
lead_paragraph: The three men arrested on charges of supporting the Islamic State led quiet public lives, the authorities say, but privately they raged at what they saw as wicked behavior around them.

headline.main: In Brooklyn, Eager to Join ISIS, if Only His Mother Would Return His Passport
headline.print_headline: Eager to Join ISIS, if Only His Mother Would Return His Passport

snippet: The three men arrested on charges of supporting the Islamic State led quiet public lives, the authorities say, but privately they raged at what they saw as wicked behavior around them.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
